channel.title: Avarrocka - once and for all
channel.description:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/OjLPlj9.png[/img][/center] [hr] [size=12pt][i]I'm pretty sure that many of you already seen this a million times. You may call it a failure. However, I'm far from being done with it. For those who don't me, I've been working on various projects(can't even count them all). Most of them died within a week. Avarrocka gave me this power and confidence that I wouldn't expect from a simple name. It has been my only long-term project that I've been working on for few years. I've had many issues before. As many may know, the old version of Avarrocka was leacked and It pretty much went to trash. It's all about reputation. Once you gather it and go trough progress, you get your piece of cake after all that. I may sound totally of-earth but that's the truth. That being said, I'm here to bring up all my experience together and finally finish this once and for all. The base won't be the older Avarrocka. This time I'm going with my previous project's Hyperion. So to sum this up:
[b]Base:[/b] Hyperion & Highly modified Galkon ref.
[b]Team:[/b] Only me
[b]Goal:[/b] Finish this and prove something to everyone including myself.[/i][/size] [hr] [img]http://i.imgur.com/Mk6ztiB.png[/img]
[size=12pt]Journey to the world of [b]Avarrocka[/b]! Avarrocka is a 317 RSPS that is packed with high quality content. Our server combines the excitement of intense PVP combat, with flawless skilling and PvE encounters that helps foster our player-driven economy. Avarrocka can simply be defined as 'unique'. For example we have a guild system that is truly meaningful and rewarding. The concept surrounding Avarrocka is one of a kind and the design (down to the smallest details) is incredible.[/size] [hr] [img]http://i.imgur.com/d0FB2AT.png[/img]
[size=12pt]We are consistently adding improvements to Avarrocka, so that it can be the best and most modified, yet stable server in existence. We're also much more inclusive than your average online destination. Avarrocka is for gamers of every breed; new members are the fiber that binds our community, so we welcome them warmly! Our focus is around our members, and the staff team works tirelessly to ensure that everyone enjoys their experience.[/size] [hr]
[size=12pt][b]Home plan[/b][/size] [spoiler]
[size=12pt]The map plan is still in place. I always had a vision that If it's well planned, you can animate a whole city. Make most of the content and actually have a dynamic city in a private server. With plenty of events and unique features, shall It come true?[/size]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/HbSyWC5.png[/img]
[size=14pt][b]Areas:[/b][/size] [spoiler]
[ul][li][img]http://i.imgur.com/WlUtLjM.png[/img] [i]Bear's Guild Area.[/i][/li] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/ino78iQ.png[/img] [i]Owl's Guild Area.[/i][/li] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/Pg6dJFU.png[/img][i] Lion's Guild Area.[/i][/li][/ul]
[/spoiler]

[ul][li][img]http://i.imgur.com/Quiuvmd.png[/img] [i]Royal Varrock Guards.[/i][/li] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/BCKiFvM.png[/img] [i]Training Portal.[/i][/li] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/l6tyx9l.png[/img] [i]Minigame Portal.[/i][/li] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/2gPOlDU.png[/img] [i]Bears's Guild Entrance.[/i][/li] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/b24T6Ek.png[/img] [i]Owl's Guild Entrance.[/i][/li] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/H4Cazak.png[/img] [i]Lion's Guild Entrance.[/i][/li][/ul]

item.title: Avarrocka - once and for all
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“lare69, post:20, topic:549401”][quote author=Zymus link=topic=668305.msg4472414#msg4472414 date=1423867398]
Try this:

private static final Map<Integer, NpcCombatDefinition> cachedDefinitions = new HashMap<>();

// ...
public static final NpcCombatDefinition get(final int id) {
    if (id < 0) {
        throw new IllegalArgumentException("id must not be null");
    }
    return cachedDefinitions.get(id);
}

[/quote]
The way he’s doing it now is definitely faster than using a map. Although you’re guaranteed O(1) retrieval performance when using Integer as a key for a HashMap, array index retrieval is still much much faster.[/quote]

Yes, but you’re not allocating memory to fit 12345 NpcCombatDefinitions (which looks like a pretty heavy class) right off the bat, if you only load 100 in the first day of running. And it would probably only be <10ms slower for lookup for every time after the first.

Read full topic

item.title: Avarrocka - once and for all
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Zymus, post:19, topic:549401”]Try this:

[code=Java]
private static final Map<Integer, NpcCombatDefinition> cachedDefinitions = new HashMap<>();

// …
public static final NpcCombatDefinition get(final int id) {
if (id < 0) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException(“id must not be null”);
}
return cachedDefinitions.get(id);
}
[/code][/quote]
The way he’s doing it now is definitely faster than using a map. Although you’re guaranteed O(1) retrieval performance when using Integer as a key for a HashMap, array index retrieval is still much much faster.

Read full topic

item.title: Avarrocka - once and for all
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Dear god…

Why, are you allocating the NpcDefinition array the moment the class is loaded? That’s a Huge area for improvement. That’s going to take up a lot of memory.

Try this:

private static final Map<Integer, NpcCombatDefinition> cachedDefinitions = new HashMap<>();

// ...
public static final NpcCombatDefinition get(final int id) {
    if (id < 0) {
        throw new IllegalArgumentException("id must not be null");
    }
    return cachedDefinitions.get(id);
}

But this doesn’t exactly solve your problem. You also need to change the way it’s loaded. Judging from the code you posted, I can’t tell how it’s being loaded, but loading it on demand and storing it in the cachedDefinition may prove to be faster and take up less memory.

Read full topic

item.title: Avarrocka - once and for all
item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

naseem142:

Bump! How are the updates going?

I’ve been busy with real life stuff. Had my birthday and been out on several activities. I did managed to get some few spare time fix one or two bugs but nothing major. I currently have 4 free days so I might get some updated. My intentions are to rewrite some few core stuff before I move to ranged/magic combat. These core stuff include: proper ground item system, a better global object system and few more things.

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:549401”][quote author=artem543 link=topic=668305.msg4470106#msg4470106 date=1422498795]
2015/05/28 - Update - Server definitions
[/quote]

Your last update is 3 months from now?[/quote]

Apologizes, I don’t know how that happen but it’s fixed.

[quote=“arham 4, post:12, topic:549401”]Posting so you can post future updates. :3

Happy birthday[/quote]

Thank you my friend <3

[hr]

Vain_:

im not sure you fully understand the meaning of ungratefulness.

[b]1. Not feeling or exhibiting gratitude, thanks, or appreciation.
2. Not agreeable or pleasant; repellent: “I will not perform the ungrateful task of comparing cases of failure” (Abraham Lincoln).

Don’t know if it applies to you. I won’t judge and argue on that subject either.[/b]

Vain_:

however, op has posted this topic numerous times with different formats. never once has he proven to follow through with development, claiming he is progressing but chooses not to inform this community of his achievements as we are “dead.” which, if he doesnt wish to update us on his progression then he shouldnt post the thread in the first place.

I agree with you. However you won’t change my mind. I’ll finish this with or without your moral help. Your type of comments give me fuel to continue this. Thank you.

Vain_:

not to mention the first months of this projects lifespan was op claiming to do so much work when he was constantly switching between 2006scape/hyperion/runesource etc.

Always great to test out server bases and decide on which you want to stay. Good thing that I wasn’t switching from PI to PI to PI and so on.

Vain_:

never has op shown any actual progression or development so i shall stand on my original point as to please stop posting this crap.

Good, I’ll try to prove you wrong.

item.title: Avarrocka - once and for all
item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

2015/1/28 - Update - Server definitions
[hr]

So basically, every server is loading different definitions to use in different contexts. Original Hyperion had Xstream system that parsed XML definitions into hash-maps with it’s custom type. So I would have something like “Hashmap<Integer, ItemDefinition>”. It wasn’t a bad system but I din’t like the file’s syntax. As many people turn to json, I did too. I used the new Asteria’s json loader and converted the old definitions into json format. I’m currently loading the following definitions:

[ul][li]Item[list]
[li]Item definitions[/li]
[li]Weapon definitions[/li]
[li]Ranged weapon definitions[/li]
[li]Equipment requirements(requirements to wield items)[/li]
[/list][/li]
[li]Npc[list]
[li]Npc definitions[/li]
[li]Npc combat definitions[/li]
[li]Npc drop tables[/li]
[li]Npc spawn locations[/li]
[/list][/li][/ul]

I’m still missing object definitions such as single and double doors. Most of objects are parsed from the raw loc.dat which can be found in the client as it already contains all needed data. I should be done with all definitions soon. Take note that it’s not full definitions and a lot is missing as some definitions are written from scratch such npc combat which contains a lot of custom data. As you can see:

package com.ar.world.entity.combat.npc;

import com.wc.world.model.Animation;

/**
 * The container that contains all npc combat definitions.
 */
public class NpcCombatDefinition {

	/** The array that contains all of the npc combat definitions. */
	public static final NpcCombatDefinition[] DEFINITIONS = new NpcCombatDefinition[11258];//Same count as npc definitions.

	/** An array of ids for each combat definition. */
	private int[] id;
	/** A {@link NpcSkill} array of skills for the npc. */
	private NpcSkill[] skills;
	/** The bonus array for the npc. */
	private int[] bonus;
	/** The death animation of the npc. */
	private Animation death;
	/** The block animation of the npc. */
	private Animation block;
	/** The combat style of the npc. */
	private NpcCombatStyle style;
	/** An array of melee combat styles. */
	private NpcMeleeCombat[] melee;
	/** The ranged style of the npc. */
	private NpcRangedCombat[] ranged;
	/** The magic style of the npc. */
	private NpcMagicCombat[] magic;
	/** The respawn delay of the npc. */
	private int respawnDelay;
	/** The delay to remove the npc after dying. */
	private int removeDelay;

	/**
	 * Creates a definition.
	 * @param id           ids of the npcs who share the same data.
	 * @param skills       npc combat skill array.
	 * @param bonus        npc combat bonus array.
	 * @param death        npc death emote.
	 * @param block        npc block emote.
	 * @param style        npc combat style.
	 * @param melee        melee attacks.
	 * @param ranged       ranged attacks.
	 * @param magic        magic attacks.
	 * @param respawnDelay respawn delay.
	 * @param removeDelay  remove delay.
	 */
	public NpcCombatDefinition(int[] id, NpcSkill[] skills, int[] bonus, Animation death, Animation block, NpcCombatStyle style,
	                           NpcMeleeCombat[] melee, NpcRangedCombat[] ranged, NpcMagicCombat[] magic, int respawnDelay, int removeDelay) {
		this.id = id;
		this.skills = skills;
		this.bonus = bonus;
		this.death = death;
		this.block = block;
		this.style = style;
		this.melee = melee;
		this.ranged = ranged;
		this.magic = magic;
		this.respawnDelay = respawnDelay;
		this.removeDelay = removeDelay;
	}

	/**
	 * Gathers the definition.
	 * @param index npc index.
	 * @return definition.
	 */
	public static NpcCombatDefinition get(int index) { return DEFINITIONS[index]; }

	/**
	 * Gets the list of ids of npcs that share the same data/
	 * @return npc ids.
	 */
	public int[] getId() {
		return id;
	}

	/**
	 * Gets the npc skills/
	 * @return npc skills.
	 */
	public NpcSkill[] getSkills() {
		return skills;
	}

	/**
	 * Gets the bonus for the specified slot.
	 * @param slot The slot of the bonus.
	 * @return bonus.
	 */
	public int getBonus(int slot) {
		return bonus[slot < 3 ? slot : slot - 1];
	}

	/**
	 * Gets the death animation of the npc.
	 * @return death animation.
	 */
	public Animation getDeath() {
		return death;
	}

	/**
	 * Gets the block animation of the npc
	 * @return block animation.
	 */
	public Animation getBlock() {
		return block;
	}

	/**
	 * Gets the combat style of the npc.
	 * @return The combat style.
	 */
	public NpcCombatStyle getAttackStyle() {
		return style;
	}

	/**
	 * Gets the different types of melee attacks for the npc.
	 * @return melee attacks.
	 */
	public NpcMeleeCombat[] getMelee() {
		return melee;
	}

	/**
	 * Gets the different types of ranged attacks for the npc.
	 * @return ranged attacks.
	 */
	public NpcRangedCombat[] getRanged() {
		return ranged;
	}

	/**
	 * Gets the different types of magic attacks for the npc.
	 * @return magic attacks
	 */
	public NpcMagicCombat[] getMagic() {
		return magic;
	}

	/**
	 * Gets the respawn delay of the npc
	 * @return respawn delay.
	 */
	public int getRespawnDelay() {
		return respawnDelay;
	}

	/**
	 * Gets the remove delay of the npc
	 * @return remove delay.
	 */
	public int getRemoveDelay() {
		return removeDelay;
	}

}

item.title: Avarrocka - once and for all
item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

[center][/center]
[hr]
[size=12pt][i]I’m pretty sure that many of you already seen this a million times. You may call it a failure. However, I’m far from being done with it. For those who don’t me, I’ve been working on various projects(can’t even count them all). Most of them died within a week. Avarrocka gave me this power and confidence that I wouldn’t expect from a simple name. It has been my only long-term project that I’ve been working on for few years. I’ve had many issues before. As many may know, the old version of Avarrocka was leacked and It pretty much went to trash. It’s all about reputation. Once you gather it and go trough progress, you get your piece of cake after all that. I may sound totally of-earth but that’s the truth. That being said, I’m here to bring up all my experience together and finally finish this once and for all. The base won’t be the older Avarrocka. This time I’m going with my previous project’s Hyperion. So to sum this up:

Base: Hyperion & Highly modified Galkon ref.

Team: Only me

Goal: Finish this and prove something to everyone including myself.[/i][/size]
[hr]

[size=12pt]Journey to the world of Avarrocka! Avarrocka is a 317 RSPS that is packed with high quality content. Our server combines the excitement of intense PVP combat, with flawless skilling and PvE encounters that helps foster our player-driven economy. Avarrocka can simply be defined as ‘unique’. For example we have a guild system that is truly meaningful and rewarding. The concept surrounding Avarrocka is one of a kind and the design (down to the smallest details) is incredible.[/size]
[hr]

[size=12pt]We are consistently adding improvements to Avarrocka, so that it can be the best and most modified, yet stable server in existence. We’re also much more inclusive than your average online destination. Avarrocka is for gamers of every breed; new members are the fiber that binds our community, so we welcome them warmly! Our focus is around our members, and the staff team works tirelessly to ensure that everyone enjoys their experience.[/size]
[hr]

[size=12pt]Home plan[/size]
[spoiler]

[size=12pt]The map plan is still in place. I always had a vision that If it’s well planned, you can animate a whole city. Make most of the content and actually have a dynamic city in a private server. With plenty of events and unique features, shall It come true?[/size]

[size=14pt]Areas:[/size]
[spoiler]

[ul][li] Bear’s Guild Area.[/li]
[li] Owl’s Guild Area.[/li]
[li] Lion’s Guild Area.[/li][/ul]

[/spoiler]

[size=14pt]Activities:[/size]
[spoiler]

[ul][li] Royal Varrock Guards.[/li]
[li] Training Portal.[/li]
[li] Minigame Portal.[/li]
[li] Bears’s Guild Entrance.[/li]
[li] Owl’s Guild Entrance.[/li]
[li] Lion’s Guild Entrance.[/li][/ul]

[/spoiler]

[size=14pt]Facilities:[/size]
[spoiler]

[li] Apothecary.[/li]

[li] Furnace.[/li]
[li] Mining site.[/li]
[li] Rare trees.[/li]
[li] Runecrafting altar.[/li]
[li] Water source.[/li][/ul]

[/spoiler]

[size=14pt]Shops/Goods:[/size]

[li] Armour shop.[/li]

[li] Bar/pub.[/li]

[/spoiler][/spoiler]
